oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Association Between Bovine Corona Virus Seroconversion, Treatment Rates and Weight Gain in Feedlot Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: O'Connor, Annette
Martin, Wayne
Nagy, Eva
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine corona virus
weight gain
disease occurrence
change in titre
bovine viral diarrhoea virus
BVDV
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The relationship between bovine corona virus (BCV) titres and disease occurrence, and weight gain, in feedlot calves was investigated. 202 calves were enrolled in the study and followed for the first 28 days on feed. Outcome variables examined were risk of treatment for bovine respiratory disease (BRD) and total weight gain. Titres at day zero and change in titre to BCV and bovine viral diarrhoea virus (BVDV) were measured to examine this effect.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1999; 224-225
